The machine at Site A has the base capacity configured at the same level as the high water mark of the Site B machine and has flex capacity activated to its HWM. The flex capacity is then added to the machine at Site B, bringing it up to the Site A HWM and workload is transferred. Once all workload has been transferred (within 24 hours) the capacity of the Site A machine is reduced to the base level. Workload can continue to run at Site B for up to a year.
